intro: Collomia debilis f. camporum, commonly known as the Camp's flaxflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats such as meadows and slopes. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
